text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

We have made so many super hero themed treats that
I thought, it’s time to celebrate a villain!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something Harley Quinn themed,

and the new Suicide Squad movie is coming
out.
So I thought, perfect timing, let’s
make a Harley Quinn themed cake.
And for the first time ever on Nerdy Nummies,
let’s make a checkered cake!
So when you cut into it, it looks like a checkerboard.
Let’s get started!

To make this cake, we are gonna need to make
4 cakes.
2 black cakes and 2 red cakes.

I have ingredients for 2 cakes, so just remember,
you’ll have to double it!

The things you will need, will be: 2-1/2 cups
of water, 2/3 cup oil, 6 eggs,
we’re only gonna be using the whites.
2 boxes of white cake mix, 1 large box of
vanilla instant pudding.

To make our red cakes, we will need 1-1/2
tablespoons of
red food coloring.

To make our black cakes we will need 1 tablespoon
of
black food coloring.

And then we will need 2 round 10 inch cake
pans, a 6 inch cake
board and a 2 inch cookie cutter.
Now let’s put it all together!

In a big mixing bowl we are gonna combine
both of our cake mixes, our pudding,

our 6 egg whites, oil, and water, and mix
it together.
Now we are gonna add our red food coloring.
Mix it up 1 more time until it’s the
color red you want.

Our red cake batter is all ready and over
here I have 2 pans,

I’ve greased them and lined the bottom with
a piece of parchment paper.

And now we’re ready to pour our batter into
each of the pans.

I’m gonna pour 1/2 into each, I’m just
gonna eyeball it.
Oh you guys, I got a joke!
What is Batman’s favorite food?
Ba-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na - nana!
Erphhhmmrph!

Got my spatula, now I’m gonna smooth it
out!

Our cakes are ready to bake and now you’re
gonna heat your oven to 350 degrees and

pop both of these in there, bake for about
25-30 minutes.
And while they are baking

I’m gonna do the exact same thing, I’m
gonna make 2 more black cakes.

All of our cakes have baked, we’ve got 2
red cakes and 2 black cakes.

I’ve leveled off the top, so that they’re
flat.
And, not only have I given them

plenty of time to cool, but I popped these
into the freezer.
The reason I did this

is because when you’re cutting out the circles
and shapes, it prevents crumbling or

breaking, because we’re gonna be cutting
out a bunch of circles!
You’re gonna take the 6 inch round circles.
This is just a piece of cardboard cut

into a circle, and I’ve wrapped it in food-safe
plastic wrap.
Place it in the middle

of your cakes, then take a sharp cutting knife
and we’re gonna cut it out.

You’re gonna cut all the way through, and
try to make it 1 solid piece.

Then take another sharp cutting knife and
do the same to your black cake.

Now we’re gonna pop out our circles, we’re
gonna try to do this in 1 piece!

So, just using your fingers, be gentle, and
go underneath the cake.
Up-up-up-up-up!
There it is!
Just place it right here!
Then do the same for your black cake.

Next take your circle cookie cutter, and we're gonna cut
out the middle.
Then do the same thing over here.
Now we're gonna assemble these, this one’s gonna go red, black, red, and this one is gonna go
black, red, black.

So I like to start with the little one,
put him in here.
Boop!
Boop!
Pick him up, put him in here, boop!

This is what they should look like, and now
we’re gonna do the same thing
to our 2 remaining cakes!
Time to assemble our checkerboard cake!

Over here I’ve got a cake plate and a little bit of
buttercream frosting,

I’ve dyed it red and I’ve cut off the
end.
So I’m just gonna put a little bit of frosting down.
I’m gonna take the first layer.
Place it right in the middle!
I’m just eyeballing it!
After you place it, cover with frosting.
I’m just frosting a thin layer.
Take a spatula, smooth it out.
Agh-haahhh-kandhhh…
Ah-haa-haa-haaa—haaa!

Looking good, now we’re gonna add our next
layer, remember you want to alternate them.

This is black, so then you want to add red,
and then black, and then red!

Our cake is assembled, and now we are going
to frost the top, and the sides.

I like to start on the top, here I just have
buttercream frosting, I’ve dyed it red.

Put it in a plastic baggie and cut off the
end.
Then, take your spatula, smooth it out.

Top is frosted and now I’m gonna frost the
sides.
I put my cake stand on a turntable,
just to make it a little bit easier.
Eee-dee-da-dee!
Dee-dee-da-dee, da-dee-da-dee!
Dee-dee-da-dee, da-dee-da-dee!

And now, it is time to decorate, this is my
favorite part.

Over here we’ve got 3 different colored
fondant, we have regular, marshmallow

fondant, just leaving it white, black and
red.
Some mini edible pearls,
these are white drages!
Little mini white gum balls, white buttercream frosting,

I’ve got it in a plastic baggie, with a
number 12 tip.
a small circle cookie cutter
and a diamond shaped cookie cutter.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is roll
out our black fondant.

I’ve got a piece of wax paper down here
on the surface so that it won’t stick.
Now to cut out some diamonds.

You’re gonna take your diamond cookie cutter,
and you’re
gonna need to cut out a bunch of these.
Because they’re gonna go all the way around
the bottom of the cake.

We’ve got all of our diamonds cut out, and
now we are gonna place them at the

bottom of the cake, like a border, and go
all the way around.
With a little pearl in between.

We finished the diamond design at the bottom,
and now we’re gonna take these little

edible white pearls, I’m using some baking
tweezers, just to make this a little bit easier.

But, you are gonna place one of these at the
top of each diamond, boop!
And go all the way around.

Our diamond designs are looking good and I’ve
got some white buttercream frosting
here to pipe along the bottom border.
Just a reminder, I have a number 12 tip,

and we’re gonna be making little dots, all
the way around.

Next we’re gonna decorate the top of the
cake by rolling out our white fondant.

Once you’ve got your fondant rolled out,
now we are going to use a little fondant
cutter, and cut out our design.

And if you don’t have one of these, that’s
totally
fine, you can just use a sharp cutting knife.
Now I’m just gonna cut out a whole
bunch of wiggles, like this…

I’ll show you, because this isn’t really
that helpful!

I’m cutting out the collar of Harley Quinn’s
classic comic book outfit.

Got our design cut out, now we’re gonna
peel up the extra fondant and place it in the
center on the top of our cake.

Got some excess white fondant rolled out 
over here and I’m just gonna cut

out 2 small circles, with our little circle
cookie cutter.
Doo-doo!
Like theeeese!

And then 2 rough, large eye shapes, don’t
have to be perfect, because these are
gonna be on the back end.
Like I said, they don’t have to be perfect!

To complete Harley Quinn’s Jester outfit,
we are going to roll out red and black

fondant, and cut out pieces to make her jester
hat and mask.

Once you have all your shapes cut out, we’re
gonna do a little bit of assembly.

We’re gonna take these little floppy things
and we’re gonna place them on the
back of our mask. to cover the eyes.
And when you turn it around….
Looks just like her mask!

Got all of our pieces cut out and now we are
gonna attach our little white circles to
the jester hat.

So I’m gonna dab a little bit of water,
then stick him on.

We’ve got our jester hat pieces all ready,
and I’ve cut a little slit on the
top of the fondant over here on the cake.
And I’m just gonna place them right there.
Doo-doo, da-dew-dew!

Now we’re gonna put our mask on, and you
can just lean it right against our hat.

Final decoration step, we’re gonna add these
little mini white gum balls right here,
at the end of each loops on her collar.

Then we’re just gonna do this all the way
around.
Ta-da!

Here is the Harley Quinn themed cake that
we made today!
A big thank you

to you guys for suggesting something Harley
Quinn.
I’m very excited for the

movie Suicide Squad to see all the villains
in action for once.
Hee-hee-hee-hee-hee!

Let me know in the comments down below who
your favorite villain is.

This is the first time, on Nerdy Nummies,
that we ever made a checkerboard

cake, when you cut into it, it will look like
black and red checkerboard.
Oooooh!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures of this
cake and posting them on Facebook, Twitter,

Tumblr and Instagram, and if you guys make
this cake, please take a picture and

send it to me, I love seeing your baking creations,
I get a big kick out of it.
It just makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!

Ba-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na,
nana!
